title: June 2018
caption: Against school opposition and internal politics, Zack, Alex, and Mike forged their way to Spaceport America. After driving 40+ hours straight, they assembled their first ever high-powered rocket in the desert. For their vast resolve, they received a Team Spirit award.
stats: Eagle I v1 - 8,500 ft apogee - Mach 1.0

title: November 2019
caption: Pushing the envelope with new technology, Eagle I v4  featured RRPL’s first integration of telemetry, complete with GPS and video recording capabilities. The launch gained Alex Level 3 high-power certification, the highest certification for amateur rocketry.
stats: Eagle I V4 - 12,000 ft apogee - Mach 1.1

title: August 2020
caption: The first success in RRPL’s line of 2-stage vehicles, this rocket was a direct stepping stone to space. After a 22 hour drive to Kansas for the launch, the rocket’s 6-hour recovery process was quite a story. This is currently RRPL’s highest flying and most complex rocket system.
stats: Eagle II v3 - 15,000 ft apogee - Mach 1.1
